content.question: The parametric function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is defined by <math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals open parentheses x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close parentheses"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>. If <math alttext="x open parentheses t close parentheses equals 2 plus tan t"><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>tan</mi><mi>t</mi></math> and <math alttext="y open parentheses t close parentheses equals 2 plus sec t"><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>sec</mi><mi>t</mi></math>, which of the following is an asymptote of the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> in the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane?

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
